meanings.definition: People who practice self-flagellation as a form of religious discipline.
meanings.sent1: The flagellants gathered in the church to seek repentance through self-punishment.
meanings.sent2: The flagellants walked barefoot through the streets, whipping themselves in a solemn ritual.
meanings.sent3: The flagellants decided to have a flagellation contest to see who could endure the most lashes.
meanings.sent4: The flagellants' devotion to their faith was so strong that they saw self-inflicted pain as a path to salvation.
meanings.sent5: The image of the flagellants' bloodied backs stayed etched in the minds of the onlookers.

meanings.definition: A group of individuals who publicly whip themselves as a form of penance.
meanings.sent1: Witnessing the flagellants' procession was a somber reminder of the power of repentance.
meanings.sent2: The flagellants' actions shocked the townspeople, who watched in silence as they inflicted pain upon themselves.
meanings.sent3: The flagellants' self-punishment routine became a strange tourist attraction in the small village.
meanings.sent4: The flagellants' public display of penance was a stark contrast to the private nature of their beliefs.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the flagellants' whips echoed through the square, drawing curious onlookers.
